metadata.title: CVE-2014-9276 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in theSpecial:ExpandedTemplates page in MediaWiki before 1.19.22, 1.20.x through1.22.x before 1.22.14, and 1.23.x before 1.23.7, when $wgRawHTML is set totrue, allows remote attackers to hijack the authentication of users withedit permissions for requests that cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks viathe wpInput parameter, which is not properly handled in the preview.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9276` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mediawiki - 1.23.7
mediawiki-classes - 1.23.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mediawiki package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.23.7').
